name: cringcat
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), ccat))
-| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))

stmt.origin: subccat(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), cfv(cringc, c0), c2, wcel(c0, c1))
stmt.pretty: subccat(((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2), (RingCat ` c0), c2, c0 ∈ c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), ccat))
-| wceq(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubc, cfv(cringc, c0))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2)∈ Cat)
⊣ ((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2)=((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ c1 → c2 ∈(Subcat `(RingCat ` c0)))

stmt.origin: crhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3)
stmt.pretty: crhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubc, cfv(cringc, c0))))
-| wceq(c3, cin(c0, ccrg))
-| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c1)
-| diffsc(s0, c3)
-| diffsc(s1, c0)
-| diffsc(s1, c1)
-| diffsc(s1, c3)
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c2 ∈(Subcat `(RingCat ` c0)))
⊣ c3 =(c0 ⋂ CRing)
⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ c3, s1 ∈ c3 ↦(s0[RingHom]s1))
⊣ d(s0, s1)
⊣ d(s0, c0)
⊣ d(s0, c1)
⊣ d(s0, c3)
⊣ d(s1, c0)
⊣ d(s1, c1)
⊣ d(s1, c3)

comment: The restriction of the category of (unital) rings to the set of commutative ring homomorphisms is a category, the "category of commutative rings". (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.)
